message: Hey guys, you can talk about Neal's games here
10:30 - Excellent spending however, but with Chrono you could be further ahead
12:30 - 3gate expand discussed as safest option that can lead to a macro game
16:00 - Discussion of running away from faster units
17:50 - Excellent defensive formation
Tophat is voss
meow?
6:00 - You're visibly throttled on gas. It's hurting you here by limiting your production to zealots
10:00 - Full Chrono Energy
18:00 - That concave of yours is much better than your opponent's earlier
20:00 - Discussion of inappropriate micro during battle: running back and forth gives colossi free shots.
8:00 - Dan notes you're forgetting units in your base during a fight
11:00 - Brent points out that 4gate leads to only 4gate. Limits your macro highly
17:00 - Notably behind on upgrades. Might not be super important at this level, but it's why you're losing even fights.
you're so silly Laneums
3:00 - Discussion of the need to build first assimilator earlier
hit that function key again to regain the screen position
6:30 - Aaron asks if you should build an Observer first from your Robotics Bay
I think I will call you that from now on Dan
lol
First game watched: Metalopolis, Neal vs. Fremen
As long as we're going to be watching these for an hour... I can't imagine going an hour without the gong ♥
lol
6:15 - Too long without making probes
how do the screen hotkeys work?
make sure units aren't attacking buildings
i agree with good concave of units on trackstar's part the whole time
4:00 - Discussion of hotkeys and the need for an observer hotkey
pylon placement, so that 1 pylon isnt powering all production buildings
4:30 - Place buildings away from ramp to weaken your opponent's scouting
guardian shield
1:00 - Same problem as the first game: delayed gas
good to know.
upgrades
I am Dan.
Don't worry about micro as much as macro. If you're not in Master or high diamond, Macro is going to win you more games.
3:00 - Discussion of lack of guys in gas as soon as the assimilator goes up
ctrl + F5-F9 binds the screen position to a function key
Make sure to have a next step throughout the game so you always know what to do next.
hahaha that looks like "too phat"
Second game watched: Sanshorn Mists, Neal vs. Jason

Summary of comments thus far: go gas earlier, consider picking a cookie-cutter 3gate expand from liquipedia and sticking with it to diamond league, get upgrades, and continue making probes and chrono boost throughout the game.
I'm interested to know who you are
10:00 - You should transfer probes from main to expansion, especially if you have more than 22 miners on base.
Third game watched: Xel'Naga Caverns, Neal vs. scarykumquat
7:00 - Discussion of why four gate into expand is bad. Worse with late gas.
13:00 - Discussion of 3gate double forge into expo build from Liquid.Tyler
Tophatman, are you on the CSL team?
interesting...never learned that one
14:30 - Use your observer more, particularly to see tech and tank position
Game 3 Recap: Scout more, upgrade more. If you get a lead, don't throw it away. Know the situation through scouting, and tech switch/expand based on what he's doing
8:00 - Discussion of running an Observer in even if they can scan it. Verdict: you should.
15:30 - Discussion of how pulling back to your ramp effectively gives it to the Terran
10:00 - BOOST
15:00 - FFs trapped your zealots behind your stalkers. You should have blinked too.
thanks for taking such awesome notes lane :)
12:00 - Discuss of broad macro as seen in http://www.teamliquid.net/forum/viewmessage.php?topic_id=191702
Game 2 Recap: Scout early, use observers, hotkey observers, keep army out in the open
4:45 - As long as your probe is by his base, you can block the expo by running around or building a pylon

Suggestion, have a hotkeyed scout unit at all times. (not necessarily the same unit) Utilize the hotkeys to be able to bounce back and forth from the scout unit to whatever the point of interest is. Vision is an important underutilized resource.
15:30 - "You're miles ahead."
5:00 - Late small zealot push. Bad idea.
6:30 - +1 weapons upgrade is a must if you push with zealots.
pcwer: 100% agreed that zealots can be good against zerg early on. Got to be faster than this though
9:20 - Mention of Twilight Council that's doing nothing

Preference, I like your 4 zealot rush, but it could be refined. Since you don't really utilize the cybercore, you could delay the cybercore. If you continue using the 4 zealot push, try to maximize your efficiency to get out 4-5 zealots.
11:30 - Discussion from Nozick: 4gate to diamond, then diversify
19:00 - The zerg can see you on creep, keep your army together
19:30 - Be willing to change your plan ingame
better scouting
22:00 Comments across the board about scouting
22:30 Guardian Shield cuts down about 30% of the damage of unupgraded mutas.
